comments:
I've been seeing various errors last night when Bugzilla was unstable. Most of them shown error dialogs, but for some reason also ended up in the log file. Please verify if it should be there. I have feeling that Mylar should have either use Eclipse standard tracing options or have special switch in the ui that will enable more verbose logging. That may also help to resolve issues with proxies. -- Error Log -- Date: Mon Dec 04 01:15:57 EST 2006 Message: Failed to submit to repository: Changes may not have successfully committed. Posting to https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs failed: Mark invalid Severity: Error Plugin ID: org.eclipse.mylar.core Stack Trace: java.io.IOException: Mark invalid at java.io.BufferedReader.reset(BufferedReader.java:485) at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaClient.postTaskData(BugzillaClient.java:754) at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaTaskDataHandler.postTaskData(BugzillaTaskDataHandler.java:145) at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.tasks.ui.editors.AbstractRepositoryTaskEditor$31.run(AbstractRepositoryTaskEditor.java:2488) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58) ------------------ -- Error Log -- Date: Mon Dec 04 01:16:07 EST 2006 Message: Report download failed. Unrecognized response from https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs. org.eclipse.mylar.internal.tasks.core.UnrecognizedReponseException:

Software error:

Can't connect to the database.
Error: Too many connections

 Is your database installed and up and running?
  Do you have the correct username and
password selected in localconfig?

For help, please send mail to the webmaster (webmaster@eclipse.org), giving this error message and the time and date of the error.

at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaClient.parseHtmlError(BugzillaClient.java:989) at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaClient.getTaskData(BugzillaClient.java:423) at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaTaskDataHandler.getTaskData(BugzillaTaskDataHandler.java:110) at org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.ui.SynchronizeTaskJob.syncTask(SynchronizeTaskJob.java:147) at org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.ui.SynchronizeTaskJob.run(SynchronizeTaskJob.java:87) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
See 166669 for more errors related to this same outage.
*** Bug 166625 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

traces.message:
Software error:

 Can't connect to the database. Error: Too many connections   Is your database installed and up and running?   Do you have the correct username and password selected in localconfig?

For help, please send mail to the webmaster (webmaster@eclipse.org), giving this error message and the time and date of the error.
